page.title: 17CHURCHES GT.CANFLD/H.RODING
page.content: ST. MARY THE VIRGIN CHURCH & CEMETERY: Foundations laid about 1150. Construction: walls flint rubble with occasional use of Roman brick; roof 15C. Many interesting features - chiefly red and yellow ochre fresco (reputedly finest in East Anglia) depicting Virgin and Child painted over the altar ca 1250. Covered for protection during Reformation and forgotten. Rediscovered 350 years later during alterations. Church is in good repair (Grade I listed), seating capacity ca 150 in oak pews. One Sunday service, average attendance 25. Non-stipendiary priest-in-charge Revd Peter Duncan. HIGH RODING CHURCH & CEMETERY: Present structure dates from 13C. Walls:flint rubble. Feature: 14C doorway.Seating 150.Grade II listed. Parish linked with Aythorpe & Leaden Roding.
